title-group.article-title: Learning by Doing: An In-Class Exercise of the Treasury Auction Market

abstract.p: This paper presents an in-class exercise to help students learn the way the Federal Reserve carries out an auction of U.S. Treasury bills and the way bidders perform price discovery. The exercise (developed for one class session) is complete with when-issued data for students to use in developing competitive bids for a specified block of T-bills. Students immediately learn if their bids are successful. All students then apply the resulting stop price to calculation of the annualized discount yield and expected rate of return on investment. The author examines assurance of learning with an independent t-test to measure the contribution of the exercise to student understanding of the auction process.
